page.title: 08Farming
page.content:
Local farms produce grain and cattle. An example is Lea Farm.The farm has a herd of 75 pedigree cattle known as the Wybunbury herd.The herd can produce 280 gallons of milk a day.Some of the fields have been sown with Norman wheat.The name comes from the woodland which used to surround the farm.
Lea Forge Farm, a mile from Wybunbury is a trout farm occupying 11 acres, of which 2 acres are water.Fish are bought in bulk and then sold to Ross Fisheries, the public and local inns and restaurants.
Cockshades Farm, near Shavington is a "Pick Your Own" soft fruit farm, growing strawberries, rasberries, gooseberries, blackcurrants, potatoes and redcurrants.
